Text:
Beyond the grubby door is an expansive darkness so
 deep it feels like it will suck me right in.

Within I find another door that I also go through.
Inside is a dingy chamber.

The chamber contains a single door and a woman in
restraintsâ€”Violet.
Hey.
...Hey.
Was it you who called me here?
Called you...? I don't think so.
But I did enjoy our fight.
Same here.

My memories are patchy at best, but I'm certain
you're the strongest I've faced. If only you had
been alive in my dayâ€¦
I'm honored to hear that.
So why are you here?

There was this pesky door that wouldn't leave me
alone, so I gave in and went through it.
I'm not sure I understand.
Neither do I. Anyway, you know how to get outta here?
Good question. I don't recall ever leaving.
But what about our fight?

One minute I was here, the next I was there. I'd
never experienced anything like it, at least as
far as I can remember.
Really. Well, that's not much help.
Guess I'll just try going back the way I came.
Wait.

What about the beautiful woman you see sitting
before you?
She's chained up.
Would you mind helping me out of these?

Oh, I thought you were training. I used to do stuff
like that myself.
...How novel.

I break Violet out of her restraints using my Academy
sword since I can't use my slime one.

She stretches with pleasure, a nostalgic smile
crossing her face.
Mm... My first taste of freedom in a thousand years.
Really.
Basically.
I don't quite recall, but it's been at least that long.
Now, I do believe our goals align.
You want to escape, and I want to be free.
Correct?
Yeah, guess they do.
Then let's work together.

Fine with me, but didn't you say you've never left
here?
Yes. But I do know how to free myself.

This Sanctuary is a prison for memories created
during a war in a bygone age. If we destroy the
magic core at its center, I'll be freed.
Just you?
Me.

Or so I would like to say, but once the core is
destroyed, everything in here will disappear.
You should be able to escape too.
Doesn't that mean the Sanctuary will vanish?
Well, yes. Is that a problem?
I mull over the question in my head for a moment.
Nope.
Then it's settled.

Oh, and I'm sure you already noticed, but you cannot
wield magic here.

We're near the center of the Sanctuary. Any attempt
to use magic will see it sucked away instantly.
Looks that way.

(It's like a way stronger version of what the
terrorists used. Try to work magic and you
can kiss it goodbye.)

(I'm testing different things, but this might take
some time to work around.)
No problem either way. I'm good at breaking stuff.

My, how reassuring. Incidentally, without magic I'm
merely a frail maiden.
I've always wanted to be protected by a brave knight.
You certainly don't act like someone weak.
By the way, what're you gonna do once you're free?

Why, fade into nothingness. I am just a memory,
after all.

Beyond the door is a forest in the light of dawn.
The sun trickles through the trees, causing the
grass, wet with the morning mist, to sparkle.
Where are we?
Inside a memory.
Your memory?
It does look familiar.

After walking through the quiet forest for a while,
we stumble upon a clearing.

In the middle of the open space, showered in sunlight,
sits a young girl with her knees clutched to her chest.
Looks like she's crying.
It does.

We approach the girl together. When leaning over to
get a look at her face, we can see that her purple
eyes are brimming with tears.
She looks just like you.
Merely a passing resemblance.
Why's she crying?
She probably wet the bed.

Aurora's words are hiding something. The girl weeps
silently. There are conspicuous bruises on her body.
So...what're we gonna do?

If we want to press onward, we need to put an end to
this memory.
Meaning?
Crying won't change anything.
Aurora slaps the girl across the cheek.
Talk about mean.
It's fine. This is me, after all.
So you admit it.
And then the world comes apart.

Like a mirror shattering, the forest breaks into
fragments and fades into the deep darkness.
We are left in an abyss devoid of anything.
